metadata.jobDescription:
Technical Account Manager - Cursor

Location: San Francisco / New York (in-person)
Department: Go-to-Market (GTM)

Cursor is seeking their first Technical Account Managers to work with strategic
enterprise customers. The position focuses on driving adoption and delivering
business value while influencing the product roadmap.

Key Responsibilities:
- Build relationships with engineering leaders and power users at key accounts
- Partner with Field Engineering and Sales on post-sale customer success
- Drive Cursor adoption by aligning usage with business and engineering goals
- Guide customers on rollout strategy, prompt optimization, and team enablement
- Represent customer needs internally and influence roadmap priorities
- Conduct strategic planning and business reviews with VP and CTO-level stakeholders
- Monitor account health and engagement metrics to support renewals and expansion

Required Qualifications:
- Strong communication skills and executive presence with ability to engage both developers and executives
- Deep understanding of software development lifecycle and engineering organizational structures
- Technical fluency in workflows, AI tooling, and developer productivity
- Customer-focused strategic thinker with problem-solving capability
- Startup mindset: scrappy, proactive, and adaptable
- Prior experience in TAM, Solutions Architecture, Customer Success, or enterprise software consulting

hero.subheadline: Developer tools PM who knows what makes engineering teams adopt—and stay. From Flow CLI to institutional crypto infrastructure, I've driven enterprise adoption where the technical bar is high and the stakes are real.

about.tagline: Eight years driving developer adoption at the intersection of technical depth and enterprise trust—from SDKs to institutional infrastructure.
bio:
I've spent my career making complex infrastructure accessible to developers while earning the trust of their leadership. At Dapper Labs, I owned the Flow CLI and Cadence Playground, reducing time-to-first-deploy by 60% through relentless focus on developer onboarding. At Anchorage Digital, I work with institutional clients managing billions—Galaxy chose us for ETH staking specifically because the infrastructure I built met their compliance bar. That means presenting to CTOs on technical architecture and following up with their engineers on implementation details.
What draws me to Cursor is the developer productivity mission. I've lived the pain of fragmented tooling and know what it takes to drive adoption in engineering orgs—both bottoms-up with power users and top-down with engineering leadership. My startup experience (Ankr: 15× revenue growth, 5-person team, survival mode) means I know how to be {{accent}}scrappy and proactive{{/accent}}. I want to help enterprises unlock what Cursor can do for their teams.

caseStudies.reasoning: Direct developer enablement experience. CLI + playground = developer onboarding. 60% improvement shows measurable adoption impact.
Enterprise customer success with institutional clients. VP/CTO stakeholder engagement. Winning against competitors on trust.
Startup mindset proof. 15× growth, customer discovery, B2B adoption motion with protocols as customers.
Cross-functional coordination, customer enablement frameworks, account health metrics via RICE scoring.
SDK for enterprise customers (gaming studios). Technical enablement for non-crypto-native teams.
Enterprise stakeholder management at scale. Technical credibility with both builders and executives.

projects.reasoning: AI interest and hands-on experimentation—shows genuine curiosity in AI tooling space.
